availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City & County of New York } ss:

I Gardiner S. Hutchinson having been duly appointed a Commissioner in New York for the State of Kentucky to take the acknowledgment of Deeds &c. to be used or recorded therein do swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of my station as such commissioner as aforesaid.

Sworn to before me this 10 day of March 1862
Justice Supreme Court

figure.ab:
G. S. HUTCHINSON
COMMISSIONER
NEW YORK.

body.p: annexed is an impression of my official seal

G. S. Hutchinson
A Commissioner in New York
for the State of Kentucky

New York
Oath of G. S. Hutchinson
Filed Mar 18 1862
